caption.text: Comparison between the autosampler presented here and two commercial models.

cell.text: 95; can be expanded without modifying sample size if a larger tray is designed; or a larger tray can be built, along a larger table, so that a larger number of large samples can be accommodated
32; more samples can be added if extra trays are pilled upon each other, but these need to be purchased separately
Sphere with 6 mm in diameter when using a tray for 49 samples; it can take larger samples but then the tray needs to be swapped with one for less samples at once
Sphere with 10 mm in diameter, but only if purging flow is largely increased
Samples need to be placed inside their respective holes in the carousel
Samples need to be placed inside carousel, and then a flushing procedure lasting about 10 min is needed. If more samples need to be added, the flushing needs to be repeated again.
Samples need to be placed inside their respective holes in carousel and a lid needs to be placed over the tray. If the lid is forgotten, large air blanks are introduced in the measurement.
3D-printed or readily available from hardware stores
Proprietary, only for designed partner companies
Proprietary, only for designed partner companies

statement.text: Parameter Sample adding procedure has This autosampler of Samples need to be placed inside their respective holes in the carousel.
Parameter Compatibility has This autosampler of Samples need to be placed inside their respective holes in the carousel.
Parameter Sample adding procedure has This autosampler of Universal via AutoIt.
It is clear from there that the autosampler presented here is a low-cost and viable alternative to existing commercial models.
